articles.author: BASSEM MROUE and ZEINA KARAM
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Insurgents' stunning march across Syria accelerated Saturday with news that they had reached the gates of the capital and that government forces had abandoned the central city of Homs.
articles.title: Insurgents reach gates of Syria’s capital, threatening to upend decades of Assad rule

articles.author: THOMAS ADAMSON and JOHN LEICESTER
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Howling winds couldn’t stop Notre Dame Cathedral ’s heart from beating again.With three resounding knocks on its doors by Paris Archbishop Laurent Ulrich, wielding a specially designed crosier carved from fire-scorched beams, the monument roared back to life Saturday evening.
articles.title: An archbishop's knock formally restores Notre Dame to life as winds howl and heads of state look on

articles.author: SYLVIE CORBET, ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON and JILL COLVIN
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — French President Emmanuel Macron welcomed Donald Trump to Paris on Saturday with a full dose of presidential pomp as the two held a hastily arranged meeting with Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskyy before celebrating the grand reopening of the Notre Dame Cathedral.
articles.title: Trump is welcomed by Macron to Paris with presidential pomp and joined by Zelenskyy for their talks

articles.author: JILL COLVIN
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — He's making threats, traveling abroad and negotiating with world leaders.Donald Trump has more than a month and a half to go before he's sworn in for a second term.
articles.title: Trump isn't back in office but he's already pushing his agenda and negotiating with world leaders

articles.author: KIM TONG-HYUNG and HYUNG-JIN KIM
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea's embattled President Yoon Suk Yeol avoided an opposition-led attempt to impeach him over his short-lived imposition of martial law, as most ruling party lawmakers boycotted a parliamentary vote Saturday to deny a two-thirds majority needed to suspend his presidential powers.
articles.title: South Korea's president avoids an impeachment attempt over short-lived martial law

articles.author: MICHAEL BALSAMO and MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The gunman who killed the CEO of the largest U.S. health insurer likely left New York City on a bus soon after the brazen ambush that has shaken corporate America, police officials said.
articles.title: Days after gunman killed UnitedHealthcare's CEO, police push to ID him and FBI offers reward

articles.author: TOM MURPHY and DEVI SHASTRI
articles.description: For years, patients in the U.S. health care system have grown frustrated with a bureaucracy they don’t understand.
articles.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO's shooting opens a door for many to vent frustrations over insurance

articles.author: AUDREY McAVOY
articles.description: PEARL HARBOR, Hawaii (AP) — Ira “Ike” Schab, a 104-year-old Pearl Harbor attack survivor, spent six weeks in physical therapy to build the strength to stand and salute during a remembrance ceremony honoring those killed in the Japanese bombing that thrust the U.S.
articles.title: 2 Pearl Harbor survivors, ages 104 and 102, return to Hawaii to honor those killed in 1941 attack

articles.author: MOLLY QUELL
articles.description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — An explosion and fire rocked a neighborhood in the Dutch city of The Hague on Saturday, killing three people and injuring other people and destroying several apartments, according to authorities.
articles.title: An explosion destroys an apartment block in a Dutch city, killing at least 3 and injuring others

articles.author: JONATHAN LANDRUM Jr.
articles.description: SAN DIEGO (AP) — When Aaron Pierre was cast as Mufasa, the weight of following in the late James Earl Jones' legendary footsteps was enough to rattle any actor.
articles.title: How 'Mufasa' rose with Aaron Pierre and Blue Ivy's voices along with new Lin-Manuel Miranda music
